title: 'Flip or Flop' Star Christina Anstead's Husband Ant Hands Over His Rights To Their $4.1 Million Home
text:
“Flip or Flop” star Christina Anstead’s new husband has filed court documents to establish her as the sole owner of their $4.1 million home, only months after getting married.

According to court records obtained by The Blast, Christina’s new husband, Ant Anstead, has filed an ‘Interspousal transfer grant deed’ in court.

The document states, “This conveyance establishes sole and separate property of the spouse.”

The document adds, “it is the express intent of the grantor, being the spouse of the grantee, to convey all right, title and interest of the grantor, community or otherwise, in and to the herein described property to the grantee as his/her sole and separate property.”

Ant’s documents mean he is giving up all interest in the mansion, if they are to ever separate.

Christina bought the home in June 2018 for $4.1 million. She has been renovating the home and even added a pool.

In December 2018, Christina got married to Ant Anstead during a surprise ceremony at the home. The two got married in front of 70 friends and family in Newport Beach. The couple kept the whole thing a secret by telling friends they would be meeting at the home before being shuttled by a bus to watch the Newport Beach Christmas Boat Parade.

The couple began dating in October 2017 after she split from her hubby and co-star, Tarek El Moussa.
description: Only months after the two got hitched.
